source.0e64fd1d:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,30))
plt.subplots_adjust(left=0.1,
                    bottom=0.1, 
                    right=0.9, 
                    top=0.9, 
                    wspace=0.4, 
                    hspace=0.4)

plt.subplot(4,2,1)
un, count = np.unique(data.Price,return_counts=True)
count = list(count)
un = list(un)
un = un[len(un)-3 : len(un)] + ["Paid"]
count = count[len(count) - 3 : len(count)] + [sum(count) - sum(count[len(count) - 3 : len(count)])]
count, un = zip(*sorted(zip(count, un)))
count = list(count)
un = list(un)
count.reverse()
un.reverse()
plt.title("Pricing Type")
plt.ylabel("Type")
plt.xlabel("Count")
plt.bar(un,count,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])


plt.subplot(4,2,2)
un, count = np.unique(data.Publisher,return_counts=True)
count_sorted = list(count)
count_sorted.sort()
count_sorted.reverse()
count_sorted = count_sorted[:21]
un_sorted = [un[list(count).index(i)] for i in count_sorted]
count_sorted, un_sorted = zip(*sorted(zip(count_sorted, un_sorted)))
plt.title("Top 20 Publishers")
plt.ylabel("Publisher")
plt.xlabel("Count")
plt.barh(un_sorted,count_sorted,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])

plt.subplot(4,2,3)
un, count = np.unique([i.split("-")[2] for i in data['Date of Release'].values],return_counts=True)
plt.title("Top Year")
plt.ylabel("Year")
plt.xlabel("Count")
plt.barh(un,count,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])
plt.tight_layout()

plt.subplot(4,2,4)
un, count = np.unique(data.Category.values,return_counts=True)
count, un = zip(*sorted(zip(count, un)))
plt.title("Trending Categories")
plt.ylabel("Category")
plt.xlabel("Count")
plt.barh([i.split(">")[-1] for i in un[:21]],count[:21],
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])
plt.tight_layout()

plt.subplot(4,2,5)
plt.title("App Sizes")
plt.xlabel("Size Range")
plt.ylabel("Count")
n, bins, edges = plt.hist(data.Size.values,bins=10,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen"])
plt.xticks(bins)

plt.subplot(4,2,6)
un, count = np.unique(data["Age Rating"],return_counts=True)
plt.title("Age Rating")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.xlabel("Age Rating")
count = list(count)
un = list(un)
count, un = zip(*sorted(zip(count, un)))
plt.barh(un,count,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])
plt.tight_layout()

plt.subplot(4,2,7)
un, count = np.unique(list(itertools.chain.from_iterable([i.split() for i in data.Languages.values])),return_counts=True)
count, un = zip(*sorted(zip(count, un)))
count = list(count)
un = list(un)
count.reverse()
un.reverse()
un = un[:21]
count = count[:21]
count, un = zip(*sorted(zip(count, un)))
plt.title("Top 20 supported languages")
plt.xlabel("Language")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.barh(un,count,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])

plt.subplot(4,2,8)
un, count = np.unique(data.Game_Pass,return_counts=True)
plt.title("Game Pass Availability")
plt.xlabel("Availability")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.bar(un,count,
       color = ["mediumspringgreen","mediumaquamarine","aquamarine","turquoise","lightseagreen","mediumturquoise","skyblue"])
plt.tight_layout()
source.77d978b7:
Prices

Prices are present in both text and monetary format. Extract the required money value or Free if the game is free or Included with Game Pass or Included with EA Play if that is the pricing option available. Add an optional Game Pass feature to measure how many games provies game pass.
source.09c9b84f:
Size

Obtain missing File sizes from Microsoft Store and Internet
source.6eda2a21: Inference : Free and Paid are the two popular payment types with majority being Free. Very few games have Game Passes or EA Play. Microsoft Corporation is the bigger publisher of apps and games. Amount of apps and games published has seen a steady growth from the year 2010 to 2021. Word, Shopping, Ringtones & Sounds, Local Experience Packs, Navigation & Maps, Food & dining, Remote Desktop, Design Tools, Legal & HR are the top categories out of the top 20 trending categories. Rest of the categories contribute to the rest of 50% of the top 20. Considering the size of all the apps and games, majority of them come within 20.8 GB. The higher sizes are mainly contributed to by the Games. Large number of the existing apps and games are rated for Ages 3 and up. The amount of apps or games with explicit content is significantly less as the rating for older ages is relatively less in comparison with the younger ages. English(UnitedStates) is the commonly supported language among apps and games with support for other regional languages distributed among the rest of the apps. Majority of the games do not have a game pass availability although the games with game pass availability is quite large as well.
source.e28a4939:
Date of release

Take the missing date of releases from Internet

source.d8bc0abd:
Size

File Sizes are present in KB, MB and GB. Convert to GB for uniformity.
source.cab4f1b6:
Languages

Languages are present in space separated string with Language(Country) format. Split and put them in a list. For missing values, select top 37 languages since most of the Microsoft Apps support a large variety of languages.
